image.altText: A man with brown hair speaks into a microphone and adjusts his red Make American Great Again cap

props.synopsis: A school investigation has been launched after an Adelaide teacher allegedly dressed up as slain US conservative activist Charlie Kirk for Halloween, with the school's principal slamming the decision to wear such a costume as "completely unacceptable".

title.children: School sorry for 'unacceptable' Charlie Kirk costume at Halloween event

image.altText: A hospital side alley that looks gloomy

props.synopsis: SA's Health Minister has apologised to a patient who was ramped outside hospital for several hours as the government releases its ambulance ramping data for October, which is at a six-month low.

title.children: Apology issued to woman stuck in ambulance outside hospital

image.altText: A woman in a business suit looks serious while seated

props.synopsis: South Australia's Independent Commissioner Against Corruption (ICAC) Emma Townsend has taken over an anti-corruption commission described by her predecessor as the "weakest integrity agency in Australia". Does she agree?

title.children: SA's ICAC 'busier than ever' despite watered down powers

image.altText: Warning sign about asbestos

props.synopsis: An electrician diagnosed with a rare asbestos-related cancer has been awarded a $2.26 million payout for exposure to toxic dust and fibres while working for various employers, including at the old Royal Adelaide Hospital.

title.children: Former RAH electrician awarded $2.26m asbestos cancer payout

image.altText: A woman with red hair shows the solar power app on her phone with a house with solar panels behind her.

props.synopsis: There has been a flurry of installations in home batteries and rooftop solar in Mount Gambier following the launch of a community bulk-buy renewables program.

title.children: SA city's bulk-buy renewables program drives surge in battery and solar uptake

image.altText: Paul Logos wears glasses and a navy and white striped polo shirt. Behind him is sand coloured brick and red flowers.

props.synopsis: Paul Logos may never know for sure if his wife's recent death could have been preventable by helipad access. Six helipads throughout regional South Australia remain closed due to issues in certifying their safety.

title.children: Paul may never know if his wife's death was preventable by helipad access

image.altText: Close up photo of a woman on a missing poster

props.synopsis: Police are not ruling out returning to a property near Mount Gambier where they searched yesterday for the remains of Margaret Bernie, who was last seen in the South Australian city in 1988.

title.children: Search for remains in suspected SA cold case murder unsuccessful

image.altText: A bald man in a teal, black and white tie and black jacket speaks to the media at a press conference

props.synopsis: Warren Tredrea's premiership teammate Josh Carr says he will always remain a Port Adelaide legend despite being sacked from the club's board last week.

title.children: Port coach denies Tredrea kicked out of club despite board sacking

image.altText: Smiling man in hat stands among artworks

props.synopsis: Known for his generosity and a spectacular art gallery home filled with colourful works, Peter "Jungle" Phillips is remembered by those who loved him dearly.

title.children: Adelaide artist 'Jungle' Phillips dies aged 69 in his colourful home

image.altText: Dead marine life at Adelaide's West Beach.

props.synopsis: New research awaiting peer review has provided a few revelations about the make-up of South Australia's algal bloom, with a new predominant species — Karenia cristata — identified by scientists. Here's what we know so far.

title.children: What is the new species detected in SA's algal bloom?

image.altText: A non-identifiable child playing with toys.

props.synopsis: South Australia's childcare regulator has cancelled the registration of just one provider in recent years, while nearly 10,000 reported incidents have resulted in no further action, FOI documents obtained by the ABC have revealed.

title.children: Nearly 10,000 SA childcare incidents reported resulted in 'no action'

image.altText: A man and woman holding a newborn granddaughter

props.synopsis: The consequences of a contaminated biopsy sample, which led to a man being wrongly diagnosed with lung cancer and having part of his lung unnecessarily removed, were "profound", a coroner has found.

title.children: Man's misdiagnosis with cancer after pathology error 'linked with his death', coroner finds

image.altText: An architectural render featuring modern buildings and an abundance of pedestrians.

props.synopsis: The WA premier insists a cancelled upgrade of the Perth Convention and Exhibition Centre would not have been value for money, despite the deputy premier previously describing the building as a "cockroach".

title.children: Why plans for 'cockroach' building upgrade were scrapped

image.altText: Kai Ellice-Flint holds the WSL trophy after his longboard win

props.synopsis: Kai Ellice-Flint joins fellow NSW Central Coast native Molly Picklum to become Australia's second world surfing champion as he wins the longboard title in El Salvador.

title.children: Aussie star wins surfing world title on board he shaped himself

image.altText: Gough Whitlam listens to dismissal announcement

props.synopsis: The main characters are dead. But some of those who were around at the time still maintain their rage, five decades after the events in question.

title.children: From the best seats in the house, I watched history be made

image.altText: A dark-haired man in a collared shirt and jeans stands in a shop with racks of jeans behind him.

props.synopsis: A millionaire fashion boss is banned from entering Byron Bay's party precinct as he awaits trial over violent sexual offences.

title.children: Millionaire fashion boss charged with violent sexual offences in Byron Bay

image.altText: Two plain clothes detectives escort a man in handcuffs from a house

props.synopsis: Police will allege the man used his position as a bank employee to assist the syndicate in applying for approximately $10 million worth of business loans.

title.children: Ex-NAB employee charged over alleged role in $200m bank fraud syndicate

image.altText: Meta logo in background in focus with blurry silhouette heads in foreground.

props.synopsis: Users of Facebook, Instagram and WhatsApp are exposed to fraudulent e-commerce and investment schemes, illegal online casinos, and the sale of banned medical products.

title.children: Meta forecast $24b revenue from scam ads, internal documents show

image.altText: Road signs at a dusty outback intersection.

props.synopsis: A former police officer who travelled more than 700 kilometres to steal $100,000 from a convicted sex offender has been jailed for 10 years.

title.children: Former NSW cop jailed for $100k home invasion robbery

image.altText: A child holds their parent's hand as they approach a building with "Richneck Elementary School" written on the wall.

props.synopsis: The teacher was critically wounded when the boy shot her in front of a full classroom almost three years ago.

title.children: American teacher shot by 6yo student awarded millions in damages

image.altText: An immensely tall male basketballer battles with two smaller players during a game in front of a large crowd.

props.synopsis: Olivier Rioux causes pandemonium as he debuts for Florida and becomes the tallest player ever to grace the hardwood at the college level.

title.children: 236cm teenager becomes tallest-ever US college basketball player

image.altText: A man wearing a red leather jacket, with curly locks across his forehead, smiles

props.synopsis: Antoine Fuqua's movie was meant to be released months ago, but was delayed twice because of reshoots and eventually pushed back to April 2026 — a whole year behind schedule.

title.children: Trailer for Michael Jackson biopic released a year behind schedule — with a glaring gap

image.altText: A person wearing blue holding a dark blue United States of America passport.

props.synopsis: The US Supreme Court allows Donald Trump's administration to enforce a policy blocking transgender and non-binary people from choosing passport sex markers that align with their gender identity.

title.children: US Supreme Court lets Trump block trans people from choosing passport gender

image.altText: A blue and white United commercial plane on top of a motorway overpass with blue and black parking road signs

props.synopsis: As many as one in 10 domestic flight services are set to be cut from daily operations at 40 major US airports due to the ongoing government shutdown.

title.children: US preparing for 'weekend of chaos' amid widespread shutdown flight cuts

image.altText: A picture of a blonde woman embracing a blakc greyhound with a greying face.

props.synopsis: This is what you had to say about the heartbreak that comes with the death of a pet.

title.children: 'I still cry about him': Your stories about the grief of pet ownership

image.altText: Salmon pens photographed through trees.

props.synopsis: The industry's use of the drug is in response to an "endemic" bacterial disease that caused the deaths of up to 15,000 tonnes of salmon from January to April, resulting in dead fish material washing up on multiple beaches.

title.children: Antibiotic approved for Tasmania's farmed salmon — but maybe don't eat fish caught nearby

image.altText: A man with short dark hair and a beard looks sideways at the camera

props.synopsis: Craig Robert Dale is jailed for seven years for defrauding the remote Aboriginal community of Warmun out of $2.7 million, to fuel his gambling.

title.children: Man jailed for defrauding millions from remote WA Aboriginal community

image.altText: Harmanpreet Kaur celebrates with the World Cup trophy

props.synopsis: In a short period of time, women's cricket in India has travelled from uneven, dusty grounds to floodlit stadiums packed with roaring fans. The team's upset victory promises yet more investment in the women's game from the world's most fanatical cricketing nation.

title.children: With India's World Cup victory, women's cricket is forever changed

image.altText: Nick Kyrgios sits and looks in front of him

props.synopsis: Nick Kyrgios insists he won't be taking Aryna Sabalenka lightly but nor is he ready to be rolled by the women's world number-one in their Battle of the Sexes clash.

title.children: Can Kyrgios beat the best female player in the world? He thinks so

image.altText: Marshawn Kneeland looks at the camera

props.synopsis: The NFL is in mourning after the tragic and sudden loss of Dallas Cowboys defensive end Marshawn Kneeland, who was just 24.

title.children: NFL player Marshawn Kneeland of Dallas Cowboys dies aged 24

image.altText: GettyImages-2220931004

props.synopsis: Min Woo Lee will not be joining countryman Cameron Smith by defecting to LIV Golf, saying he aims to join his sister as a major champion on the PGA Tour.

title.children: 'I'm not going': Min Woo Lee emphatically ends LIV Golf rumours

image.altText: Posters of a person throwing a sandwich are pictured along a wall with graffiti

props.synopsis: Sean Charles Dunn became a symbol of resistance to Mr Trump's deployment of federal agents in the nation's capital following a viral video showing him tossing a sandwich at a Customs and Border Protection agent.

title.children: Man who threw sandwich at US border agent found not guilty of assault

image.altText: The sun rises above a highway in a red and yellow sky.

props.synopsis: According to the World Meteorological Organization, each of the past 11 years has been the warmest in 176 years of observations — and it will be "virtually impossible" to limit global warming to 1.5C in the next few years.

title.children: 'Unprecedented' temperatures continue, with 2025 among three warmest years on record

image.altText: A poster of a young girl holding a teddy bear

props.synopsis: Temu and Shein are under increasing pressure to explain how child sex abuse dolls were sold worldwide on their multi-billion-dollar platforms following international outrage.

title.children: Shein, Temu face more pressure after claims pleas on sex dolls were 'ignored'

image.altText: A wide shot of suburban housing on a hill.

props.synopsis: The role of migration is one of the most contentious elements to the housing debate. So what does the evidence show?

title.children: These charts show the effect of migration on Australia's housing story
